metadata.name: Photofrin 2 5 mg 1mL Injection powder for solution

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Indicated in the treatment of esophageal cancer

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Porfimer is a photosensitizing agent used in the photodynamic therapy PDT of tumors Porfimer is indicated for the palliation of patients with completely obstructing esophageal cancer or of patients with partially obstructing esophageal cancer who cannot be satisfactorily treated with Nd YAG laser therapy reduction of obstruction and palliation of symptoms in patients with completely or partially obstructing endobronchial nonsmall cell lung cancer NSCLC and the treatment of microinvasive endobronchial NSCLC in patients for whom surgery and radiotherapy are not indicated The cytotoxic and antitumor actions of porfimer are light and oxygen dependent Tumor selectivity in treatment occurs through a combination of selective retention of porfimer and selective delivery of light

incompatibilities.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Darbepoetin alfa is combined with Porfimer sodium
The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Erythropoietin is combined with Porfimer sodium
The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Peginesatide is combined with Porfimer sodium
The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Methoxy polyethylene glycol epoetin beta is combined with Porfimer sodium
Riboflavin may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Verteporfin may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Methoxsalen may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Carprofen may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Aminolevulinic acid may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Tiaprofenic acid may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Protoporphyrin may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Trioxsalen may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Acetophenone may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Motexafin lutetium may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Motexafin gadolinium may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Hexaminolevulinate may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Rostaporfin may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Cyamemazine may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Temoporfin may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Talaporfin may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Bergapten may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Dihematoporphyrin ether may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Titanium dioxide may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Clofazimine may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Tretinoin is combined with Porfimer sodium
